alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 6:35PM MST until August 18 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Harshaw Creek, Santa Cruz River and Sonoita Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Patagonia Lake State Park, Kino Springs and Lochiel. - http://www.weather.gov/tadd
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
